Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcfinsf
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, tucked-away hotel that is truly attentive to its small number of guests. Our every question and request was met with smiles and help. The morning breakfasts were quick and delicious--a nice start to our busy sight-seeing days. We arrived late our fist day in Venice, and the on-shift concierge walked to a nearby restaurant to arrange a delicious dinner. Later in the week, the staff helped us get a reservation at a fantastic restaurant that seats only a few folks per night. And, best of all, our room: We stayed in the annex and it was as if we had our own apartment in the heart of one of the quieter sections of the Dosoduro. Just magical.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Charming House DD724, Venice”
Reviews.Author: tsangmor
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location (away from the crowds but very convenient), great service with friendly and helpful staff, warm breakfast with freshly cut fruits, close to water taxi loading point Cons: Bed linen can be a lot better, i.e. ours was too rough

Reviews.Title: “More beautiful and relaxing than charming.....”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: Charming house DD724 certainly earns its place as one of Italy's best kept secret. The rooms are lovely and the service is simply fantastic. The staff are attentive but leave you in peace. This hotel has the great facililties and the staff are very helpful for first timers in Venice. I doubt you will find a better hotel or service anywhere in Italy or the planet for that matter. So much so we will be coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Josi B
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel,tucked away down an alley away from the main tourist areas.Lovely rooms,good breakfast and helpful staff.We caught a water taxi there as there were 4 of us and we had a lot of luggage and it was only metres from the drop off point which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an amazing experience...”
Reviews.Author: tom_overing
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at DD724 and enjoyed every minute of our it. We arrived by water bus at Zattere and found the hotel very easy to find despite being hidden down a narrow alley. We received a very warm welcome and found the location to be perfect. February was a good time to visit as it was not overly busy in Venice and the weather is just warming up. The room was of a high standard and kept clean. As there are only 7 rooms it was quiet at all times and we only come across one other couple during our stay so we felt like we were the only guests. The service received from the staff was very personal, we had the breakfast room to ourselves and had coffee, eggs and bacon made to our liking. The breakfast was delicious and excellent quality. The staff were always on hand to recommend local restaurants and attractions. We were recommended Aqua Pasta which was an excellent choice. We went for a stroll in the evening near to the hotel and it was soooooo peaceful you could hear a pin drop. We didn't see anybody else around, this truly is the ideal location to get away from it all and kick back and relax after a long day. My tip is see what the real Venice has to offer and just keep walking down narrow alleys in the opposite direction to everybody else, you will get some stunning photos. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we will definately recommend you to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The name of the hotel says it all”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: Charming House DD724 is a boutique hotel like no others in Venice. A true gem. Despite being very close to the Guggenheim museum, the Accademia and a short walk from St. Mark square, it is hidden in an area of Dorsoduro away from the hordes of tourists. The interior is beautifully appointed, spotless clean and modern with great artwork. Our room overlooked a small canal and we loved the view. It was spacious, comfortable and very elegant in an understated way and so were the breakfast room and all other communal areas. We value the intimacy of very small hotels, but we do not like the old fashioned and fussy interiors of most Venetian hotels with their fake antique furniture. This hotel has the lot: sharp minimalist look, small number of rooms, exceptionally helpful, charming and discreet staff. We shall be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in beautiful designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: loeske k
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of times in this unique hotel and we love the design of the place. A super breakfast and a great location. It is just that eye for detail that we love. We try to do the same for our passengers who are sailing with us (www.scicsailing.eu)!

Reviews.Title: “your own quiet, cozy corner in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: jmrmd
Reviews.Content: Venice is beautiful. Nobody can deny that. However, it is so busy that one would feel tired from the sensory overload in trying to imbibe everything it has to offer. That is why the Charming House is perfect. Tucked in an alley in Dorsoduro that is minutes from the Academia, it feels like one is coming home from a day's work. The staff is (as the cliche goes ) charming and helpful. The rooms are stylish, clean and QUIET. I just wish there is room service because the place is so nice that one would just want to lounge around after a day of walking instead of going out to eat. Don't get me wrong though. There are excellent restaurants steps away from the hotel. It's just that a place like this is where one can withdraw from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelthornton
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel, good location for sightseeing, lovely rooms, a great breakfast and great front office staff. They recommended some great restaurants to eat in and none of them disappointed. If I ever go back I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with modern style”
Reviews.Author: drewski711
Reviews.Content: We love staying in the Dorsoduro when we visit Venice. While it's a bit of a longer walk to St. Mark's, when you cross the Academia Bridge, things get much quieter. Charming House DD 724 is a great choice for those looking to enjoy Venice without all the crowds and noise. Compared with the Ca Pisani where we've also stayed, DD 724 is a smaller hotel and definitely more quaint. My wife and I were traveling with my mother in law - the hotel was nice enough to put us in the small apartment about 100 yards from the main hotel. For the three of us it was absolutely perfect- the rooms were very well kept, had great Nespresso coffee makers in the room and had wonderful beds. Their alternate "apartment" is literally 42 steps from the entry to the Peggy Guggenheim (I counted it off myself!). Breakfast in the main hotel is very nice with excellent service. The breakfast hostess made sure we had enough coffee and a full stomach to brave the day! The rooms are quite and more spacious than you'd expect from Venice (although the bathrooms at the Ca Pisani are nicer, these were still very very good). We also really like the vibe from the staff- they were incredibly helpful without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Old Mattress, Cold Water, Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Pollescu
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Charming House DD724 I was expecting a nice, small, boutique hotel with great service and perfect accommodations. Yet I got a very, very, very small room that was falling apart, and a terrible service. I really regret I picked this hotel. Our 2 nights stay was a true disaster. A â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel cannot fail at providing basic services. I enlist some issues I encountered: 1.- The mattress in our bed was old, it had 2 holes with the shape of a person, on each side of the bed. You cannot have a â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel with that kind of matresses!!!! It was extremely deformed!!!! (See pictures) 2.- The floor on our room was uneven. We stayed at room A. It seems the floor is sinking in the center of the room. The floor itself has a slope of at least 4-5 degrees. Our luggage (with wheels) moved because of the floorâ€™s slope. Why isnâ€™t the floor straight?? Even?? That is a structural failure on the building that you should be fixed ASAP. (See pictures) 3.- Hot water.... If other guests were having a shower at the same time we were trying to shower, it would become a hot water war. How can the hotel say itâ€™s a â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel if they canÂ´t guarantee hot water for ALL the guests!!!! 4.- We found that the Hotel has women-only personnel, therefore I had to help carry my heavy luggage to my room. I love women working at hotels; they always seem to know how to make your stay better. Yet they should always have someone whoâ€™s strong enough to move and carry luggage!!! Specially if the hotel is so little and corridors and stairs are so tiny. 5.- English speaking..... on our checkout, the lady that charged our credit card did not speak English. She didnâ€™t even knew how to operate the CC terminal, she said my CC was declined 3 times, when I had to tell her how to use the terminal, and my CC did go through. But the worst part was she could not speak proper English, I felt she did not understand me and I could barely understand her. I speak fluent English, Spanish and French and I was unable to properly communicate with her. 6.-Service... I didnâ€™t get a farewell, goodbye, not even a â€œhave a good dayâ€� phrase when I left. The lady gave me my voucher and a handwritten little receipt; she didnâ€™t even ask if I had a pleasant stay!!!! I read incredible reviews about The Charming House, I saw it listed in amazing lists, I was expecting a true Boutique Hotel. Unfortunately, I found an old hotel, I felt like it used to be an amazing hotel, but management totally forgot what a boutique hotel is about. The core business of a hotel must be providing the best sleep among the best services available. Yet DD724 failed in providing a decent mattress, failed in providing a room with decent flooring, failed in providing hot water, you failed as a Boutique Hotel, I am so disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Gregory Y
Reviews.Content: what a charming and great experience we had, we originally were going to spend three days in Venice and ended up spending five. great location, great staff, great facilities, great city. what more can we say....it was worth everything....

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like my stay”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: My experience was so different than the posts listed here. Maybe it's because I like typically like larger hotels (although I have positive reviews of smaller, boutique hotels) but really didn't like my stay here. Room was small, run down and super dirty. I felt the hotel pics didn't match what I got in terms of my room. I could always hear my neighbors. Breakfast wasn't that great and the room really smelled horribly (every day). Overall, nothing made me think "here's a place I want to stay here again". To be fair to the staff, my stay was back in July 2010, so perhaps some good changes have taken place!

Reviews.Title: “...a charming place to stay in a charming city.”
Reviews.Author: albert d
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was very friendly, and the room was comfortable. Breakfast was good. The location was away from the heavily visited neighborhoods (happily), but very close to the Peggy Guggenheim collection and the Punta Della Dogana (Pinault Foundation) museums, and close enough to the rest. Breakfast was included, and quite good. Wi-fi is offered, but does not necessarily reach the room.

Reviews.Title: “Two days at the Biennale”
Reviews.Author: ParisGabyg
Reviews.Content: Good location, good service, very nice room, very small nice and cosy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming House - is really charming!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda D
Reviews.Content: Charming House DD724 was great! I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a clean and hip place to stay in Venice. Plus the location is great - walking distance from all of the main attractions in Venice, but located in a less touristy area. The staff could not have been more hospitable, and the breakfast was amazing!! I'll stay there again when I get the chance to visit Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Very Sweet People!”
Reviews.Author: harvey m
Reviews.Content: Great staff - very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. We speak zero Italian, so their assistance, in English, was a must. They arranged for transportation for us when we asked and, in general, made our time in Venezia that mch better. We loved the location - we felt like a part of the city. When we come back, we will stay here! Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming with the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: Anyone traveling to Venice should check out DD724 especially if they prefer modern interiors as opposed to the traditional Venetian style. The hotel is perfectly situated steps from the Peggy Guggenheim Museum which is a must see. The staff are extremely helpful and even got me into La Fenice for an unscheduled performance of a solo Soprano and her pianist. Breakfast every morning was just right and made to order if you wanted, the coffee was perfection and if you end up in a room at the DD694 location run by them, you'll feel like you actually live in Venice. Inexpensive and no fuss. Just right.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort”
Reviews.Author: Gussie H
Reviews.Content: The Charming House is a lovely little nest from which to swivel and explore. It combines easy access with , very unusually for Venice, a quiet and pretty location. Irene is possibly the most helpful receptionist in Venice, she even came out in freezing weather to ensure out water taxi had turned up. Breakfast was excellent. They did everything they could to help and make our visit easy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “"Home Away From Home."”
Reviews.Author: SujanLamichhane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and I was impressed. I have got some Ideas from the Hotel Staff and helped me to go around the City. The staff are all very courteous and very knowledgeable and very friendly especially Ina. so i felf like a home. The Room was neat and clean. Breakfast had a nice simple selection catering for many different cultures. At the end, i have enjoyed my stay with all staff and management. I Definitely will come back and stay again at Lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Venice at Charming House DD724”
Reviews.Author: shantiram
Reviews.Content: A slightly strange title for a hotel, but indeed a very helpful and accommodating set of staff to answer questions and help with troubleshooting. Quite charming. Wonderful, peaceful location away from the most crowded tourist spots. Not too far from water taxi - Salute on the 1 Line being nearest. Inside - modern, clean decor with a hint of old Venice awaits. But like most of Venice, things are on a small scale. Shower no tubs in some rooms etc. Great WiFi speed - stipulate when getting password if you are a Mac user...caused an initial problem for me. Possibly thicker dividing walls would be nice. I was in the building closest to P Guggenheim Collection. And more free English speaking TV channels needed for the room price (at least more BBC and CNN). Many English speaking guests likely to stay. Overall, a memorable night in enchanting Venice with minor niggles.

Reviews.Title: “Significantly overrated”
Reviews.Author: Weddingexpert
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Venice and after having done much research trying to find a boutique style "design" hotel - we were largely disappointed at this largey overrated "designer hideaway". The rooms were small and somewhat cramped, they lacked attention to cleanliness and looked tired around the edges. The bedding consisted of a simple cotton sheet only! The reception was squashed into a tiny space of about 2 sqm (!) and generally the guest areas such as the breakfast room and lounge were simply too small to be truly comfortable. Being an intimate hotel (yet clearly not owner-managed) - it also lacked the attention to personal service and hospitality that one ususally finds in smaller boutique establishments. The suburb of Dorsoduro is generally a good and more authentic location in Venice (as opposed to the more croweded area of San Marco) and the hotel offered a reasonably quite setting with well insulated windows. Expect the entrance to be in a small side street without a direct connection to the water canal tough. The interior decor items were chosen with the advertised "contemporary designer look" in mind (to us it simply looked practical & modern with a few arty touches) - but overall we had an underwhelming stay with a high pricetag of EUR 330.00 per night that seemed to be in no relation to the offer and a far cry from the expectations raised by clever photography on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: MeiRong369
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite, which was in their "annex". We didnt think that it would be in a building completely disconnected to the main hotel (about a 2 minute walk). The suite itself was large and comfortable, but because of their location, we decided to "downgrade" back to one of their standard rooms in the main hotel. One of the staff at the hotel (i think her name is Julia) was very very helpful. She assisted us in many matters, including re-arranging the location of meeting point with our tourguide, when we couldn't even describe the location we were at. The bedroom is generous in size, but the bathroom was a little tight. The hotel is actually a B&B, so dont expect much for facilities. We had a corner room, so the wifi signal was weak. Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of my entire trip”
Reviews.Author: uberkelly
Reviews.Content: It's all in the details. When you get into your room, you notice it's beautifully appointed. Everything from the heart-shaped monogrammed sugar pockets, to the wallpaper, to the modern and super cool light fixtures are first rate. I wanted to take home every piece of furniture in there. The bath products were amazing, and the fact that they are beautifully packaged in a wooden box makes them seem even more awesome. Apparently their fig scent is made specifically for the hotel. The room came with its own cappuccino maker (not just a hot water pitcher) with a variety of coffee pods. There was even a candle that you could light in case of mosquitoes (and like everything in the room, even the candles were prettily presented). Breakfast was no different - everything from cereal in small burlap bags (no ugly cereal boxes or containers here) to really tasty muffins, bacon, breads, and eggs made to order were available. There was even pistachio spread (a first for me) in addition to the ubiqutious nutella. You might be thinking, "I don't really care about all these tiny details, I just want a nice room". I didn't think I would care about details either. Not until I came to Charming House and was totally charmed. I even took pictures of the room because I want to try to mimic the design in my house. I am absolutely going to buy one of the light fixtures there for my own house. It's amazing what beautful, modern, tasteful design can do to a person. Oh yeah - great location.

Reviews.Title: “A veritably charming house”
Reviews.Author: JezebelleH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Charming House DD724. The hotel is lovely, extremely well located and we enjoyed the breakfasts served in the dining room. We had some trouble with the wifi internet connection which hopefully has been resolved by now. It was complicated to access the internet and the connection was unstable. We moved to the suite on our final night, which was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Maxine B
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time we had in Venice, due primarily to the Charming Houseâ€™s friendly staff and beautiful rooms We will definitely be back and recommend anyone and everyone to do so too! Arrivederci The Burgess Family

Reviews.Title: “We found "our" charming home in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: carla E
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in DD 724 for a trip to Venice. It's a little bit hidden so just check the housenumbers carefully when you enter the street. The entrance is quite small, as most in building in Venice are but you immediately notice the tasteful interior with lots of small accents carefully added accents. The modern, contemporary touch was a relief after staying in hotels in Venice several times in hotels that reflect a rather classic, "heavy" traditional style. Of course, it depends on your taste, everyone can't be the same. The staff was very friendly, we enjoyed the breakfast, one cappuccino more was no problem and was brought to us with a smile. Room nr 4 we stayed in was small but everything you need is there. The products in the bathroom are a joy to use. The small living room with books and enough space to use a laptop felt like home. Rarely we do have this feeling but we felt like this could be our own charming house in Venice! We will surely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl29
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very easily when we arrived by water taxi. The reception staff were very helpful during our stay, recommending restaurants etc. The room was also lovely, and really well decorated and it was very clean and tidy. There was two parts to our room, a bedroom and a lounge (also a bed). The breakfast was very tasty and freshly prepared for you when you ordered. They also have a good selection of chilled fruit which was also good. The location of the hotel was perfect! It is in a very nice area and located just round the corner from the Peggy Guggenheim Collection. There is also a very nice restaurant right across the canal called "Al Gondelieli" which we would recommend for a special meal out.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to name”
Reviews.Author: teecee81
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to boarding a cruise. The hotel is well situated within walking distance of St Mark's sqaure and on a small canal. It is small and queit. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds comfortable. Breakfast was well done. It might strat to feel a little cramped overall if staying longer. I wish our hostess was a little more informed about access to the cruise terminal but she was trying to be heloful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern and artsy”
Reviews.Author: cocokelly
Reviews.Content: This was a cool hotel, tucked in a corner near the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. I was afraid from the pictures that is was really dark, but it was not and we enjoyed our stay. The room was much larger than I expected after Rome and we found it perfectly situated for exploring the magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: iamfranke
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time with you DD724 The staff is wonderful and make me feel very cared for at all times. The room was comfortable and clean, the location was perfect and the local bar on the corner was a perfect compliment. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly boutique hotel, in a quiet location, very well situated.”
Reviews.Author: Amryer
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend. Very cosy Great hotel, great location. Delicious breakfasts and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: asonenbe
Reviews.Content: The Charming House was a highlight for us in Venice. It's like a mini W Hotel in the best area of Venice. The room (Jr. Suite) was amazing and the neighborhood was perfect for us since we wanted to be far away from the masses in San Marco Square and close to the Peggy Guggenheim museum (another highlight). The staff was very friendly the breakfast options were perfect. If I had one wish I would have a hands free shower (Iâ€™m not a bath or hand held shower person). A tad pricey for us, but we knew it was high seaons and we took a chance and I cannot recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Charming House & hope to be back someday!”
Reviews.Author: LODonnell
Reviews.Content: I loved every detail about our stay at The Charming House! Perfect location, luxurious bathroom amenities, simple organic styling, yummy breakfast, great price... I could go on and on. I also think we were given a room upgrade and stayed in the DD694 annex, which was so nice! It feels like you have a quaint, stylish apartment in Venice. If we ever have the pleasure of going back to Venice someday, we will without a doubt be staying there again. In the meantime, I'll be highly recommending it to friends and family traveling to Italy because it was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenmiumiu
Reviews.Content: DD724 is very nice, and I was exceptionally happy that the owner greeted us in person as we were about to check out. The whole experience of staying with DD724 is excellent. We appreciate the breakfast the most, with someone who makes eggs and bacon and fruits freshly cut for especially for you. The room lived up to expectation, which is artfully designed, while being very comfortable. I am just a bit bothered by the shower/bath where there is no shower curtain at all. Since the hotel website was exceptionally nice, my expectation for this hotel was very high. I would say it has met my expectations with not much surprises. Adding in some small surprises will do wonder.

Reviews.Title: “A magical haven away from the crowds surrounding St Marks Square”
Reviews.Content: This is like living in someones luxurious home on a backstreet of Venice. You open your windows and see the canals below and Venetian life taking place all around you. There is a little bar on the corner which serves great bellinis, there is a fabulous and tempting jewellery shop on the other corner and many other delight and individual shops surrounding the hotel. The staff here are very welcoming and helpful. The rooms we had Charming B & C were very spacious, very modern with lots of wardrobe space and lovely products for the bathroom. The views from both rooms are exceptional. Breakfast was delicious and eggs done to perfection. The Peggy Guggenheim museum is just around the corner and this was one of the highlights of our visit and if you get there at 10am you have the place almost to yourfelf for the first hour. It has a great coffee shop as well. I will definately be back again. Have stayed at The Gritti Palace previously and much prefer DD724!!! shop

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it! Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr_USUK
Reviews.Content: This was a first time to Venice, and I really enjoyed staying at Charming House's Annex in the Dorsoduro neighborhood. Hotel was well appointed and staff is very helpful in offering suggestions/reservations for dinners. I would stay their again for sure. iQS property looked really cool too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our accommodations at Charming House”
Reviews.Author: muglich
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our accommodations. It's a contemporary space which we really liked. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was delicious...scrambled eggs and bacon freshly prepared along with the usual other European breakfast offerings. There's a neighborhood bar right at the end of the "block." Quiet and comfortable. The only difficulty we had at all was that we arrived on a Mon. and no restaurant in the immediate area was still offering dinner at 9. No one at the hotel could recommend any alternative other than going over to the main island where we might find something which we weren't prepared to do. Other places in Italy we've traveled to don't really get going until about 8. We never imagined we wouldn't be able to find something at 9 or 9:30. But, we couldn't, so we went to bed hungry. Not the fault of the hotel but something you might want to be aware of since you're staying in an area which is somewhat out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICO!”
Reviews.Author: PLASTOS
Reviews.Content: My wife was able to find DD724 through a last min internet search, and we were very lucky to have found this hotel. It was perfect. Great location, away from the tourist trail, in a nice sophisticated area located next to the Peggy Gugenheim museum. The room were great, more like suits and the morning breakfast was excellent. The staff was amazing and helpful. We would return to this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: kal726
Reviews.Content: We paid 430 euros/night to stay in room A at DD724. The room was dark; there was little natural light. The room was small. Everything was fine, but nothing was exceptional. We know Venice is over-priced, but this felt like a rip-off. The room should have been 300 euros/night. The location is quite nice; the neighborhood is quiet and charming. There are decent restaurants close by. We just expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel does not protect its guests”
Reviews.Author: inloveandtraveling
Reviews.Content: When the taxi sent by the hotel did not wait for us at the airport we had to find another taxi. No big deal. But then the Charming House insisted that we still pay the water taxi $100 euros (not so charming after all!) We tried to reason with t he hotel for two days and eventually we simply refused to pay. However the stress they caused us was totally unnecessary. They should have been on our side. Breakfast was above average each morning. Eggs and uncooked bacon plus an assortment of breads and cereals. The location was teriific, right near the Academia Bridge. Free wi-fi worked ok most of the time. There was a lump in the middle of the bed and for $335 euros per night we found that to be unacceptable. There is a delightful tavern across from the entrance of the Charming House. Overall Charming House was, indeed, very charming. Except for the incident described above, the staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with warm service”
Reviews.Author: chrisyipper
Reviews.Content: Within a short reach of Accademia and in close proximity with major sites in Venice. The rooms were stylish and spacious with good service. The manager took extra steps to help us find the right restaurants, although the check-in staff were a bit helpless in getting the TV fixed. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very chic but you best have a good sense of direction”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: was in annex - gorgeous room WITH GREAT FREE WIFI. but dark and a bit old world trying to get in and out. nearly walked in on the neighbor bci ciuldnt find the door in the dark nor did i know where the light switch was. im a business traveler so it was my error to stay in venice. but this hotel was very very chic - atleast my room was chic. never saw rest bc i left too early in am and arrived too late

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and cozy experience”
Reviews.Author: Katie8754
Reviews.Content: We booked via emailing Charming House DD724, and they always responded promptly and courteously. The email implied that we would get a free entry ticket to a museum or gallery as part of our pre-booking non-refundable deal, however on arrival this was not offered to us, but nor did we make a point of asking for it. The hotel and room were pleasantly decorated in a contemporary style, and bathroom (well shower-room) was well kept and luxurious lighting. There was complimentary shampoo, soap, body wash and moisturiser, which lasted 2 of us for 3 nights, but bring your own conditioner. Rooms were immaculately tidied each day, so if you are wanting to keep old newspapers for the crossword or empty water bottles to re-use the next day, hide them in the wardrobe! Curtains were heavy and kept the light out, although earplugs was a useful addition to comfortable sleeping, as other guests returned home of an evening. Excellent location for the Guggenheim art gallery and fabulous pizza at Ae Oche, Zattere al Ponte Lungo 1414. Best bits - breakfast... croissants, cereal, yoghurt, juice, coffee, tea, eggs and crispy prosciutto, with a summary of news specific to different countries printed out for you and the day's weather report. Also an inviting lounge area next to this. Another best bit was free internet access within the hotel to use with smart phones or laptop. Improvement could be directed at the hotel reception... tiny space which they had to fit in, which could benefit from some further creative innovations when it came to storage, as ultimately they looked a bit disorganised with nowhere to lean on or put anything. Nice sweets though.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Charming' Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nellsbelles
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in Venice for a Valentine surprise for my husband as it was modern in style, compared with most of the hotels which were very chintzy. Position in Dorsodoro area was very good and a short walk from the water bus station. The hotel has only 7 rooms,so very small, but very welcoming. Breakfast was limited but adequate, the restaurant the hotel recommended was very expensive and overrated, but that is a matter of opinion. All in all a very enjoyable stay and i would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hideaway with a contemporary style”
Reviews.Author: CYTT
Reviews.Content: We stood four nights in February 2011 and enjoyed every minute. Worth the money. Perfect style and service. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “As charming as its name”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_Street
Reviews.Content: Charming House DD.724 is a great find: classic Venetian on the outside, but 21st century from top to bottom on the inside. All of the fitting in the room and bathroom were extremely high quality and very modern. The buffet breakfast was tremendous: absolutely delicious croissants, great coffee, and jams. I would highly recommend this to friends visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming”
Reviews.Author: LouiseN_10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from europe and we wanted to say thank you for the wonderful room and time we had at Charming House. The Junior Suite was beautifully furnished and we loved our time with you. Venice is an amazing city, and Charming House made it even more wonderful. The breakfasts were lovely and your recommendation for restaurants was fantastic. Please thank the lovely owner, Chiara, for this.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Venice address - Stylish. Hip. Cozy. Discreet.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalfromDC
Reviews.Content: If you love cozy, stylish, minimalist, hip boutique properties -- you'll love Charming House DD 724. I'm very discriminating and this lived up to the reputation. The location is discreet and decidedly local in its feel -- yet very close to everything without swimming in tourists. And while there's no traditional concierge, the helpful front desk staff assist with anything and everything. The couldn't have been more welcoming or gracious. We go to Venice every year. After finding this hidden gem, we'd never stay anywhere else. Loved the junior suite (canal views and a fireplace). Worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1953
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at The Charming House, DD724. This small, intimate, contemporary hotel is tucked away in a quiet area of the Dorsoduro area of Venice, away from the crowds, but close to Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum and overlooking a small canal. Unfortunately we were allocated the only room (A) without a canal view, in fact we had a very close view of the neighbour's wall. However, before we left we checked out other rooms and would definitely ask for a canal view room next time, in particular a junior suite, which is a much larger room than the standard. Our room was a decent size but felt small because of the the two armchairs and table, both unnecessary I feel. The bathroom was very small and nowhere around the basin unit to place toiletries. I chose this hotel because it has contemporary furnishings, which I prefer. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but does serve a very good breakfast. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem... Fantastic suites!”
Reviews.Author: dnwuschke
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Charming House IQ's and the hotel was one of our favorites parts of Venice. Although a little difficult to find at first because of the lack of sinage, IQ's is in a great location between the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. The hotel is right on the canal and with your window you can the gondoliers row past serenading their guests. The suite was immaculate and spacious. The modern decor is fresh and up to date. Our bathroom had a double shower which we loved! Also, Chiara who works at the front desk is super helpful! She gave us two restaurant recommendations which we completely loved. I would highly recommend a Charming Hotel, especially the IQ's!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Elegance”
Reviews.Author: T_sommers
Reviews.Content: The Charming House DD 724 â€“ A luxury boutique hotel that truly lives up to its name. Located in a quaint neighborhood of Dorsoduro, this location is easily accessible from the Accademia stop along the Grand Canal and just a short stroll away. The staff is warm, accommodating, bi-lingial, very informative and helpful in everyway. The rooms are spacious furnished complete with modern elegance. The breakfast area features modern works of art with hand-selected Chiliwich and Sia Home table settings. The breakfast offering consists of a wide array of delicious treats including: Bacon, eggs, fresh fruit, cereral, pasteries, juice, coffee, etc... Every attention to detail has been met even right down to their â€œheart-shapedâ€� sugar packets for oneâ€™s morning cappuccino Â­â€” The Charming House DD 724 is a sweet retreat indeed, I would return in a heartbeat! Tina Sommers

Reviews.Title: “Little place of heaven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ozdu
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at DD724 in Dorsoduro/Venice for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We booked the suite (room L) in the annex building DD694 and were not disappointed. DD694 offers a more quite and private experience. The room had 5 windows overlooking traditional Venetian houses and a canal all both sides. The room was very nicely appointment, modern, clean and it had a small kitchen with an espresso machine (complementary Nespresso's). An excellent breakfast was served in the mainbuilding at just 2 mins walk - the service at breakfast was very warm & friendly, even when we pushed our breakfast time past 10:30. Julia (who looks like Isabella Rossilini) at reception deserves a special mention, she was very accomodating, recommended excellent restaurants (Lineadombra, the Met) and gave us valuable tips when booking the grand canal tour (pay the extra 10 EURO to sit infront outside) and a concert. We would definitely come back to DD again.

Reviews.Title: “A heaven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: gatito200000
Reviews.Content: as the leaflet says , a contemporary charming hotel, in an outstanding part of Venice , where people feel at home ,looked after by a very friendly , helpful , efficient and dedicated managment and team . It has high standards on outlook and the running of thehouse . It made our stay in th city effortless .

Reviews.Title: “In contrast to the main building, the annex seems like an afterthought.”
Reviews.Author: Mmaker11
Reviews.Content: What I liked - The location was fabulous, steps from the Guggenheim. The main building was nicely designed, the public rooms and breakfast room were modern design, bright and appealing. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Great vibe. The bed was clean and comfortable What I did not like- Unfortunately, compared to the main building, the annex room seems to be an after thought. Dark and somewhat dingy (ie, smashed bugs on walls and ceiling, oily smudges on wall, toiletries set picked over, shower doors loose and off track.) My room had no number on door and I mistakenly opened my neighbors! Thank goodness they where not inside. Surprisingly, my key seemed to work on all of the doors! Non refundable for a reason, stick to the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you ask for in a vacation hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Haskin86
Reviews.Content: I guess the name of the place says it all - we were quite charmed! The location was perfect for going out for a stroll or a quick bite to eat, with great scenery (check out the canals!). After a day of adventures, we were able to return to a lovely, cozy room, super-comfortable beds, and the friendliest staff in Venice! We had such an outstanding stay, we're already planning a return trip - Venice and especially Charming House - see you then and thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Charming House DD724”
Reviews.Author: GhadeerA
Reviews.Content: lovely boutique hotel with all services an full aminities, then the best part is the busy street during the day.. and a beautiful small cafe, with the best pannini's around.. and so quite at night you'll only hear the water outside the canal in front of the entrance, moving the quite nights of this city, very close to bridges and gondola taxi stand. close to it there is a market, fresh fish and veggies, even thought ur minutes away walking from the rialto bridge market. and there is a Morano glass store, form the island next to venice of course. this hotel is a great tiny luxury in the heart of venice

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: afehr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Charming house. I can say the room was very good, stylish and in good size if you compare to others European hotels especially Venice. The bathroom was good also. The locations are fantastic, with walk distance to restaurants, shops and the bridge of Academia. Itâ€™s a small hotel so donâ€™t imagine any thing that you have in big hotel, such porters etcâ€¦ I only have good things to say about the hotel, and definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little place”
Reviews.Author: MackenziesOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quaint and well furnished. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was quite good and an enjoyable experience to share with other guests. The glow in the dark painting in our room, was unique and made us smile. We enjoyed our stay here. We felt lucky to find this place among all the Venice choices, as well as amongst all the twists and turns of the canals!

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home - Simply Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: le132
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful little hotel for ten days this August. It's in a fantastically quiet location, but just a stone's throw away from Guggenheim and the Vaporetto stop (Accademia). Our room was always perfectly air conditioned, the bed and bedding very comfortable and the decor clean and stylish. It's an intimate, chic little boutique hotel but with very reasonable prices. The breakfasts were delicious! I would have to say, though, that the best aspect of this hotel is the staff - they were kind, courteous, helpful, and nothing was too much trouble for them: at the end of our trip they felt like old friends - but not in an intrusive way. If I owned a hotel, I'd want all of them working for me!!! A very memorable trip - and don't forget to check out the tasting menu at the 'Gondolieri' restaurant just over the bridge opposite the hotel - superb!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsLawrence
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Venice staying at the DD724 for 3 nights. Such a beautiful hotel and the staff really made it special. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Such attention to details in the decor and the spacious rooms made it all the better. Delicious breakfast too - an amazing start to our honeymoon. Thank you DD724. Mr & Mrs Lawrence, 20-23 July 2009

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip-Charming House was indeed charming.”
Reviews.Author: gflame
Reviews.Content: This was just the cutest little boutique hotel. The staff were very welcoming. The room was modern and spacious. Great location to get to everything in Venice easily. The fresh breakfast each morning made us feel like we were in a B&B in the country. It was wonderful. We even got a discount for paying in cash. It was definitely expensive but so is everywhere in Venice. So comparatively, it was well worth it. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, young and trendy place located in a charming location but not luxurious enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jubejubebe
Reviews.Content: Good things: Great location, staff are cheerfully helpful when attending to requests, excellent range of books on Venice on the shelves in the breakfast room, yummy breakfast, young vibe and trendy vibe to the place, lux bedroom slippers and bathroom (nice.. ) Not good: No contingency plan for water stoppage for one whole night due to burst pipe near the hotel. So we did not manage to shower after one full summer day of walking - eeks... We were provided with 2 bottles of drinking water after asking how we were to obtain water. Kettle causes electricity short circuit (we gave up trying to make tea) Furniture not as luxurious as the pics on the website.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money... Do not stay here....”
Reviews.Author: telegony
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Venice but the first for my girlfriend so I decided to do it right and book the luxury suite at the Charming House. For a modern luxury boutique hotel, the fit and finish was poor at best, scratched furniture and surfaces, marks and flaking paint on the walls, cob webs and dirt around the room, broken fixtures in the bathroom, etc. Secondly, and probably more importantly the room constantly smelled of sewage, a fact that was clearly apparent to the proprietors of the hotel as air fresheners were strategically placed around the suite, especially all over the bathroom area. They shouldn't be renting this room as a luxury suite to anyone. Also, an issue which isn't permanent but the management had to know about was that there was construction 40 feet away from the suite which started at 7:00 a.m. every weekday morning for the full week we were there. As you can imagine the combination all of the above made for a horrific and expensive experience that I will not soon forget. Not what you want to take away from a romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DD.724 for 2 nights in September as part of our vacation. The location in the Dorsoduro was fantastic. Venice is a very busy and hectic place and the DD.724 was an oasis of calm. The room is spacious and has a comfortable bed. The window overlooks a small canal and the breakfast is excellent. Eggs are scrambled and served with panchetta and all the usual cold items one finds in Italy. The staff was friendly and helpful and the restaurant recommendations were excellent. We would definitely stay at the DD.724 again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little place”
Reviews.Author: KCandMB
Reviews.Content: Great, quiet location and a perfectly formed bijou boutique hotel. Warm, welcoming staff introduced us both into the reception late at night with a prossecco night-cap. Room more than adequate and tastefully decorated. View overlooking a beautiful, quiet canal. Breakfasts plentiful with great pain au chocolate! Thouroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay, great place, good food and very nice staff. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: ccstone
Reviews.Content: We were having a terrible vacation (food poisoning, terrible weather, etc) so we abandoned our itinerary altogether and decided to go to Italy (we love Italy). A flight attendant said she'd discovered a great place to stay in Venice, and we learned of Charming House. She could not have been more spot-on with her review. The location was great- not too far from all the action, but far enough away to have peace and quiet. The staff was attentive and out-of-their-way kind. We overslept more than once and the chef stayed late (she really didn't have to as we realized out faux pas) to make us breakfast. The amenities and style of the house were our cup of tea- very contemporary (its Italy after all!) This is unlike most of the hotels in Venice that choose to keep the baroque style. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner as well- what a lovely woman and an inspiration. In short, we felt AT HOME at Charming House and if ever we return to Venice, it is the House for us. "Impressive House" is more like it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful for honeymoons”
Reviews.Author: ancert
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to spend one's honeymoon! Great design, fab breakfast and warm welcome. Thanks for the champagne, a very special touch! Hope to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic gem in venice”
Reviews.Author: eacus
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the DD724 property, the hotel as opposed to the apartment i understand they have. The moment we arrived we had the warmest welcome and were invited to see two rooms that they had to offer us so we cold choose which one we preferred. The hotel has a great location, near enough to all of the sights to walk around easily but far enough away to feel you were not amoung all of the other tourists. The hotel iself was beautiful. It made us feel that we were in a real venetian property, small and quaint rather than a soul-less hotel. The property and the rooms were small but perfectly formed with fantastic design elements and plenty of little touches, candles in the room, great toiletries and bowls of sweets on the entrance. There was a dining room that served breakfast from 8.30-10.30 (11 at the weekend) and there was a great choice of breads, cakes and pastries as well as bacon and eggs. Next to the dining room was a lounge which had a large tv which was linked up to the internet and offered free internet - a nice and useful touch. In summary, a truly lovely find and i personally can't understand the negative reviews|

Reviews.Title: “IQ's stylish serviced apartments in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 2805liz
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room at the new IQ's concept hotel, run by Charming House. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen and a great canalside view (hearing the gondoliers singing as the go past was a fantastic part of the weekend). The suite and lobby area etc are all decorated to a very high standard and are contemporary in design... because they are so contemporary it struck me that there were a few things missing that you would normally find in a hotel of this style and calibre, such as a DVD player/ stereo in room/ ipod docking station etc. For the square footage of the space the bathroom was small but well appointed with good toilettries. There were some design oversights such as having no power points to plug in the appliances they equip you with (such as a juicer and toaster) so we plugged out juicer in on the floor and the toaster was in the lounge. Their in-room internet system would not display any images which made checking the news and weather etc impossible. Very small points but there are a few of them. Only minor criticism would be that the staff didn't always seem to communicate with each other so we had to request some things a few times but it was really not even a minor annoyance. The staff were all friendly and eager to please and the lack of front desk in the evening feels very private, so we also enjoyed that. I would definately recommend this hotel, it is worth the money and will ensure you a memorable and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's like returning home”
Reviews.Author: MarylandEnchanted
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice, where we have celebrated our marriage anniversary. It's our third time in this hotel as we are in love with its magical atmosphere. This time my husband unfortunately had to leave earlier, so I was on my own for the last two days. This gave me the time to discover many new aspects of DD724. Infact I had the opportunity get to know the personnell and the hotel a lot better. Everybody was great with me, very professional and helpful. (It seemed as if they knew that I needed a hand, given that I was alone! It was touchy!) They gave me a lot of useful advice of what to do or not, where to shop and where to eat well without emptying my wallet, like many tourists do in Venice if they look for a good meal. I did not feel alone any more: when I used to come back to the hotel in the afternoon there was always somebody there for me, with a smile and a kind word. They offered tea and cookies (shaped like the letters in the name of the hotel!!!) in the newly refurbished relax area, from where you can enjoy the sight of a secret Venetian garden. I have very much enjoyed the restyling they have told me they did this winter. In addition to this new area I have found that the entire hotel had a new, warmer and more welcoming atmosphere, with new colors and very intriguing objects. The room we always have, room C, was the same as ever (new painting though), with its usual perfect order and harmony. There was a new fig extract vanity line (they told me that its perfume has beed custom made especially for DD724). You can feel its smell in the entire hotel! Every time I return to DD724 it's like returning home! I recommend it to everybody looking for a special stay in a special city.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: luckybeggar
Reviews.Content: What a shame. Sadly, we'd have to agree with the more negative reviews here. The area that the hotel and annex (actually a floor with 2/3 rooms in a hotel 3 minutes walk away) are in is delightful. Some of the staff were helpful and friendly, the decor was stylish but everything was slightly tatty. We were glad not to be in the main building as the smell from the drains was horrendous and almost made breakfast inedible. These are things one might put up with for a reasonable rate but DD724 is extortionate for the level of accommodation and service it provides. Something has gone very wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Martinah
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice for my birthday. My partner offered me a wonderful surprise, I was unaware what was going on one day before the departure. The best part on this birthday gift was the hotel. we have stayed ar DD724, Charming House. It has a wonderful location, in the center but out of the usual tourist trodden paths. we were delighted to come back in the afternoon, after a "hard days work" as a tourist, and find the relaxing atmosphere of this trendy, Zen like hotel, rather minimalist, but very well designed and with all the comforts. also the staff is really great, you can ask them anything you think of (and belive me, we had quite a few questions), they always have the right answer! they also gave us a lot of inside information, the local's point of view, something very hard to accompilsh usually in very touristy places. our room had the most magnificent view over the canal in front of the hotel and of a small canal leading straight into Giudecca Canal. the traditional beamed ceiling blended wonderfully with the modern design. the most thing I have liked about the room was the shower. it was so big and comfortable! I will definitely advise all my friends and family to visit this hotel, it is a very very special place, a secret to share with your true friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern, apartment style accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Europe for our honeymoon, with Venice as one of our stops. From the moment we stepped on to the water taxi we were in love with the flair of the city. The Charming House IQs are a new apartment style hotel in Venice. Features a lot of comforts from home; there is a full kitchen, coffee/espresso maker, fridge, and dishwahser. The breakfast was just quick breads and jams, but very fresh and tastey. Staff is available from the morning till mid-afternoon to help with restaurants and directions for shopping markets. Venice is somewhat tricky to navigate with its many canals and waterways, be sure to bring a trusted map. The hotel is located near the main piazza San Marco and was quiet at night for slumber. The building the hotel is housed in, is a current residence and is situated along a main gondola route; where we were able to hear the gondola drivers singing as they rode by. Very romantic!!! The only thing the hotel was lacking was better sewage and waste disposal. For some reason we could smell the sewer in the bathroom at odd hours of the day/night. We attributed it to the hotel being new and working out the kinks. Also, bring your own toiletries. With all the supplements in the kitchen, the bathroom is lacking good travel sized products. Other than that we would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again if we ever make it back!! thank you Sophie for making our stay warm and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Liuyihao
Reviews.Content: We never encountered any of the problems complained by other people stayed in this hotel. We requested the room with the balcony, and that's what we got: a stylish room with a lovely balcony overlooking the street. The air-con worked perfectly, no misquito, very quiet. The staffs were nice and helpful. Breakfast was brilliant. We love this hotel and we shall definitely come back. P.S. the shower gel, shampoo and lotion supplied by the hotel are lovely, smell gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Appropriately named - not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCM-7
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay at this hotel. Having paid around 700 euros per night for a suite, and having arrived from Hotel 47 in Rome, we expected quite a lot. The room was interested as it was an eclectic mix of modern furniture and and overlooked one of the small canals. However, this is really not a hotel. There is no lobby; the person who is at the reception "closet" seems to do everything - bookings, housekeeping, breakfast, etc. We really didn't get much service during our stay and wound up having to fend for ourselves in most respects (I acted as porter). For that kind of money I am certain there are equally charming hotels where you can get a higher level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yet cosy boutique hotel with a warm ambience”
Reviews.Author: connoisseur01
Reviews.Content: Charming House is a modern, stylish yet cosy boutique hotel with a warm ambience. This lovely, sophisticated place has a great location in a very nice part of Venice. There is a lot of attention to details and the rooms have the best amenities. Throughout our holiday the staff was very polite, helpful and provided a signature service. I recommend Charming House in Venice strongly...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: aacc
Reviews.Content: My husband organised a surprise trip to Venice to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We are particularly picky when it comes to staying away, liking minimal rather than fussy, clean lines but also evidence of the history and tradition of the building incorporated, and I have to say that he was clearly anxious prior to our arrival. No need as, when we were shown to our room (B), it was absolutely fabulous! Could not fault it. We both loved the style of the hotel, plain walls, sculpture, paintings and photographs and books to thumb through. Lots of thoughtful touches like the box containing wonderful dark chocolates left to tempt you on your way in and out of the main door, and green tea and venetian biscuits left out in the afternoon. Staff could not be faulted. Breakfast was delicious, plentiful and beautifully laid out with fresh orchids at each place setting. The box of bathroom toiletries nicely done. Having looked at other rooms (all lovely), my husband had made an excellent choice: the fireplace with candles (which we took advantage of) was a really nice touch, the ceiling had been done to show off the original timbers and was beautiful. And, of course, the view of the canal was wonderful. Location, of course, excellent, only a few doors down from Peggy Gugenheims! One of the best places I have ever stayed in and will certainly return. I have read the other reviews and some of the negative comments. Breakfast is now served from 9am in order to minimise the noise for the occupants of the room adjacent to the breakfast area and we have been told that it is the intention to change this room into a siting area in 2007. Our only tiny grumble....would be nice if a complementary bottle of mineral water was left in the room but otherwise really couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. Special thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thompson55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near the Accademia bridge area and has a very modern feel. Be cautious of mosquitoes in your room, even in the colder months - they are everywhere. The rooms are very small, even the suites. The bathrooms are tiny and if you want a shower ask, otherwise you will just have a handheld shower in the bath! Breakfast is charged at 28 euros and is completely overpriced! You can go to the cafe outside the hotel and eat for six for that price! Rooms are only cleaned once a day in the mid afternoon and for this type of hotel they should really come back in the evening, turn down beds and clean bathrooms again, if they have been used before you go out in the evening. Toiletries are not replaced once used. This area of Venice where the hotel is does flood daily and you can be trapped inside the hotel, if you do not have the appropriate footwear or they will charge you 10 euros each for some disposable plastic boots! There is no lobby in this hotel, so we really did not spend much time there except in our rooms to sleep at night. Overall this hotel was a disappointment and we would not stay there again as it is not worth 350 euros a night for a room and I am sure there are nicer hotels in this area for the same price (a double at the Gritti can be only 425 euros!).

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Choc30
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say apart from great! We stayed here for our First Wedding Anniversary and enjoyed every minute of Venice which was helped by staying at such a fantastic Hotel. Great location - away from the hustle and bustle but still in a good position. Brilliant breakfast, helpful staff and classy room. Ate at Avogario (fantastic) and also Lineadombre (quite expensive, not quite worth the money). Must do all the sights/gondola and of course a drink at Harry's Bar! Well done to this Hotel for being in our Top Ten!

Reviews.Title: “What a HUGE disapointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheDame
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Venice and our stay at the DD724 and wow, what a HUGE disapointment. We originally booked the Gritti Palace but after finding the DD724 online thought we would like it better. Big mistake! Let me first say we were really, really looking forward to the DD724 and arrived with the utmost of hopes. That said, read below. Before arriving we were in contact via email with the office staff who kindly setup dinner reservations for us during our stay. We soon found out that the front office staff is far more helpful and kind through email compared to in person. Upon arrival I had assumed that we would be presented with a confirmation card of the restaurants they booked and the times. Nope, not even a mention. When I mentioned it to her she sternly told us the restaurant and time of the our dinner that night but no mention of the other nights. OK, not a big deal we will ask tomorrow. When taken to our room the woman told us the air conditioning was too low and we told her that it actually felt nice and that we liked it cool in the room. We left the room and went out for about 30 minutes. When we came back somebody had been in the room and turned the air conditioning to a warmer setting. If they do not want you to use air conditioning they should not provide it in the room. Our second day there was a different woman in charge of the front office, I was happy about that thinking she might have a better attitude. Nope, I was wrong. When we bumped into her in the hall and told her we needed to know what restaurant and time we had booked for the night she told us "I'm busy, I'lll check later". We could not believe it. This was also the woman that told us she had confirmed a rental car for us on the day of our check out but upon arrival to the rental location they informed us otherwise. The only person that gave good service was the woman that does breakfast. She does not speak English but was very kind and helpful. She really seemed to care about what she was doing and about how we felt. The other ladys at the front desk did not share the same attitude. As for the look and feel of the Inn, it does have a nice modern style and our room was decent size. However, the upkeep is lacking. During our entire stay there were numerous lights in the halls and stairwell that were burnt out and never changed. There were a lot of chunks missing in the walls of our room and the halls. The mattress and pillows in our room were really, really bad. It was like sleeping on cardboard. The blanket on our bed was also dirty. Our bathroom shower did not have a door or shower curtain so water went EVERYWHERE. It also only had a hand held shower head, nothing overhead. They put so much time and money into branding everything insight with there logo (which is a nice touch) but no time or energy into guest service or upkeep. The DD724 could be so much better if they only cared. It is really sad that they do not seem to.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: mikeelaine
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very nice trip to Venice. I wanted to share my experience while it's fresh! I was not looking forward to our stay to this hotel, as I had read the other reviews on Tripadvisor and I did not know what to expect. But we had received the stay as a birthday gift, so I had no choice. But everything was just wonderful! (As you might have guessed from the title of my review!) It all started in the best way possible from the moment we entered: there was this nice girl that helped us with everything in the most proffessional, yet very friendly, manner. Our room was just fabulous, you could see the canal in of the hotel. It had a lot of light and the whole atmosphere was just so warm and cosy! The breakfast was prepared with the utmost care, the tables and the help-yourself side. We took many photographs of the breakfast area, I liked the color combination they had thought of, the plates, the furniture.. Everything was so stylish! Anyway, apart from all the details (there are many things I would like to mention, but I'll cut it short), what I liked most was the overall atmosphere of a small hotel, or rather a house, where you felt right at home! I just hate the 100 rooms hotels, where you turn out to be just a number among the hundreds of clients they have every day! This is why I consider this place to be the best I have visited, it was full of personality, chic, and the personnel was just perfect! They helped us with everything we needed, in the most professional way possible! I will definitely recommend this to all my friends! It is THE place to stay when you are in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Changed hotels after one night!”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Away
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to staying in this hotel, after reading good reviews on both Conde Nast and Tablet Hotels websites. Unfortunately, we too also were placed in the TINY room next to the breakfast room. Result: No privacy, woken up very early in the morning, and felt like we were sleeping in the dining room! When we complained, the hotel could not have cared less, would not move us, and even charged us the entie amount for our stay when we left early! We just wanted to get out of there ASAP, and not have to spend another night sleeping in the breakfast room! We moved to the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal, and cannot speak more highly of this propoerty. We definitely will stay there again, and recommend it to all our friends. The service was exquisite, our suite stunning, and in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: latxeli
Reviews.Content: I have been this weekend in the hotel and I was given The next to the breakfast area room. it is a nightmare, we were not next to the rbeakfast area but IN the breakfast area. Waken up with the noise of the kitchen at 7 am and at 8 am they started putting the frozen croissants (viewed them in the fridge so it is completely true) in the oven so the result was lilke sleeping in a bakery. no privacy at all. njust 4 tables for breakfast so if you are not quick in the morning you have to queue up. they offer you an 8% discount on cash payment and once I withdraw the money, pay my bank comission they do not want to accept as they told me I had to confirm it the first day!!! completely stupid. When I asked for a complaint book they told me they do not have it... REally a disaster. I agree with some of the prior users and I highly recommend the Ca Pisani since I was doubting between the 2 and this last one has nothing to do with the dd724.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Design in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: The Charming House is quite the contrast to the city around it, but that's just the point. And even more so if you are a big fan of design hotels, which is right up my alley. This place is quite small and intimate and fantastically decorated. There were no views to speak of, at least not from our room, but the view inside was really more than enough with the way the hotel was decorated. The breakfast room and presentation there was also very classy and well done. Mind you, this place is not cheap, but then nothing is in Venice, but at least you are getting what you pay for. It's also a bit off the beaten path which makes it a little hard to find at first, but then sort of makes for a nice distance away from the high traffic tourist areas, while still being close enough to get there reasonably quickly. It is near the Academia Bridge vaporetto stop, so it's not to far away even when lugging a suitcase or two. The staff were also very friendly and glad to help us out with directions, restaurant recommendations (but don't think about going out late as everything is closed!) and such. Thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were very fortunate to have found this beautiful, romantic boutique hotel ideally located in Venice for our 15th wedding anniversary trip to Italy. I canâ€™t begin to tell you how refreshing it was to have avoided the larger chain hotels and to have had the pleasure of meeting the staff and owner of this beautiful and elegant hotel. Everyone was warm, friendly, extremely helpful and so down-to-earth that you felt as if youâ€™d been a regular at the hotel your whole life. We arrived by water taxi and we were left at a small pier just steps from the hotel. Although there had only been one room available when we had booked our reservation - upon checking in to the hotel we were surprised and pleased to learn that the hotel owner had very graciously upgraded us to a larger room. This type of thoughtfulness continued throughout our visit. Our room was cozy, elegant and every detail was thought of. Breakfast in the family-sized dining room was a great opportunity to meet more of the staff and other guests. It is this lovely hotelâ€™s staff and management who make Charming House truly deserve its name. The personal attention and warm, professional service that we received has guaranteed that weâ€™ll be returning to Charming House DD724 again as well as recommending it to all our friends and family.

HotelInfo.Name: Charming House DD724
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 724, 30123 Venice, Italy
